item.title: Dan add a quote by Gene Luen Yang
item.description: "What is China but a people and their stories?" -- Gene Luen Yang

item.title: Dan add a quote by Tim O'Brien
item.description: "They carried the sky. The whole atmosphere, they carried it, the humidity, the monsoons, the stink of fungus and decay, all of it, they carried gravity." -- Tim O'Brien

item.title: Dan add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "You never really understand a person until you consider things from his point of view... Until you climb inside of his skin and walk around in it." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Dan add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Dan add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "I wanted to tell the book thief many things, about beauty and brutality. But what could I tell her about those things that she didn't already know? I wanted to explain that I am constantly overestimating and underestimating the human race-that rarely do I ever simply estimate it. I wanted to ask her how the same thing could be so ugly and so glorious, and its words and stories so damning and brilliant." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Dan add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "One of the objects of a newspaper is to understand popular feeling and to give expression to it; another is to arouse among the people certain desirable sentiments; and the third is fearlessly to expose popular defects." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Dan add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "I almost cried. But I didn't, because if you're in seventh grade and you cry while wearing a blue floral cape and yellow tights with white feathers on the butt, you just have to curl up and die somewhere in a dark alley." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Dan add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "She came over and looked at the picture. Then she took my hand. You know what that feels like? Like what the astronauts will feel when they step onto the moon for the very first time." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Dan add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description:
"When you find something that's whole, you do what you can to keep it that way.
And when you fins something that isn't, then maybe it's not a bad idea to try to make it whole again. Maybe." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Dan add a quote by Gary D. Schmidt
item.description: "I wonder why Holling had the fastest time," said Danny after the announcements - a whole lot louder than he had to. "Could it be because he was running away from two rats who were trying to eat him?" "That might have a little to do with it," I said." -- Gary D. Schmidt

item.title: Dan add a quote by R.J. Palacio
item.description: "Kinder than is <i>necessary</i>. Because it's not enough to be kind. One should be kinder than needed." -- R.J. Palacio

item.title: Dan add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Dan add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "Don't we all live in our heads? Where else could we possibly exist? Our brains <i>are</i> the universe." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Dan add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Shall we make a new rule of life from tonight: always try to be a little kinder than is necessary?" -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Dan add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "The words were good words, Ulysses felt, maybe even great words, but the list was very incomplete. He was just getting started. The words needed to be arranged, fussed with, put in the order of his heart." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Dan add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "All things are possible. When I was a girl in Blundermeecen, the miraculous happened every day. Or every other day. Or every third day. Actually, sometimes it did not happen at all, even on the third day. But still, we expected it. You see what I'm saying? Even when it didn't happen, we were expecting it. We knew the miraculous would come." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Dan add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Peas baffled me. I could not understand why grown-ups would take things that tasted so good raw, and then put them in tins, and make them revolting." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Dan add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "Perhaps," said the man, "you would like to be lost with us. I have found it much more agreeable to be lost in the company of others." -- Kate DiCamillo
